timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                # function `websub:startHub()` to initialize a `websub:Hub` object.
          
          
            
                # `websub:startHub()` function to initialize a `websub:Hub` object.
timeline.author: praneesha

replies.bodyText:
This is a BFM convention.
Quoting from the spec,
"BFM also provides conventions for referring to Ballerina-defined names from within documentation strings in a source file. An identifier in backticks X, when preceded by one of the following words:

type
service
variable
var
annotation
module
function
parameter

is assumed to be a reference to a Ballerina-defined name of the type indicated by the word. In the case of parameter, the name must be unqualified and be the name of a parameter of the function to which the documentation string is attached. For other cases, if the name is unqualified it must refer to a public name of the appropriate type in the source file's module; if it is a qualified name M:X, then the source file must have imported M, and X must refer to a public name of an appropriate type in M. BFM also recognizes f() as an alternative to function f. In both cases, f can have any of the following forms (where m is a module import, x is a function name, T is an object type name, and y is a method name):
x()
m:x()
T.y()
m:T.y()

"
Me using websub: was wrong but we can't move "function" to after the function name.
replies.author: MaryamZi

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                # Users of the `ballerina/websub` module must use the function `websub:startHub()` to initialize a `websub:Hub`
          
          
            
                # Users of the `ballerina/websub` module must use the `websub:startHub()`  function to initialize a `websub:Hub`
timeline.author: praneesha
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -540,6 +540,17 @@ public type Hub object {
     public string publishUrl;
     private http:Listener hubHttpListener;
 
+    # The initialization method for the Hub. Users of the `ballerina/websub` module must use the
+    # function `websub:startHub()` to initialize a `websub:Hub` object.
+    #
+    # + subscriptionUrl - The URL for subscription changes
+    # + publishUrl - The URL for publishing and topic registration
+    # + hubHttpListener - The `http:Listener` to which the hub service should be attached
+    #
+    # # Deprecated
+    # Users of the `ballerina/websub` module must use the function `websub:startHub()` to initialize a `websub:Hub`

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                # object, instead of directly calling the initializer method.
          
          
            
                # object instead of directly calling the initializer method.
timeline.author: praneesha
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -540,6 +540,17 @@ public type Hub object {
     public string publishUrl;
     private http:Listener hubHttpListener;
 
+    # The initialization method for the Hub. Users of the `ballerina/websub` module must use the
+    # function `websub:startHub()` to initialize a `websub:Hub` object.
+    #
+    # + subscriptionUrl - The URL for subscription changes
+    # + publishUrl - The URL for publishing and topic registration
+    # + hubHttpListener - The `http:Listener` to which the hub service should be attached
+    #
+    # # Deprecated
+    # Users of the `ballerina/websub` module must use the function `websub:startHub()` to initialize a `websub:Hub`
+    # object, instead of directly calling the initializer method.

replies.bodyText: No, I've done this change. Please check c666b80#diff-93219952a83119ddf33cd65933550586R552

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                # + port - The port to start listening on
          
          
            
                # + port - The port to listen
timeline.author: praneesha

replies.author: MaryamZi

replies.bodyText: Since we listen "to" something, "port to listen" is correct.
replies.author: praneesha

replies.bodyText: In the context of a Server, "The port to listen on" would make sense
replies.author: chamil321
